objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: UK National Cyber Security Centre; primary author and publisher of this report and the included YARA rules.

objects.name: libsophos.so
objects.description: Copied malware path used by Pygmy Goat backdoor via LD_PRELOAD injection into /bin/sshd.

objects.name: .sshd.ipc
objects.description: IPC Unix server socket created and used by Pygmy Goat for backdoor SSH connection handling.

objects.name: .fgmon_cli.ipc
objects.description: IPC Unix client socket used by Pygmy Goat; presence suggests FortiGate targeting as per report.

objects.name: .goat.ipc
objects.description: IPC Unix server socket from older Pygmy Goat sample.

objects.name: sshdd.pid
objects.description: Single-instance PID file created by Pygmy Goat to ensure only one malicious instance runs.

objects.name: goat.pid
objects.description: Single-instance PID file used by older Pygmy Goat sample.

objects.name: sshd.pid
objects.description: PID file lock path referenced by Pygmy Goat to ensure single instance per narrative section.

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (MD5)
objects.description: Malicious libsophos.so shared object loaded into /bin/sshd (Pygmy Goat backdoor).

objects.description: Malicious libsophos.so shared object loaded into /bin/sshd (Pygmy Goat backdoor).

objects.description: Malicious libsophos.so shared object loaded into /bin/sshd (Pygmy Goat backdoor).

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (earlier variant) (MD5)
objects.description: Earlier variant of libsophos.so used by Pygmy Goat; VMProtect obfuscation and missing reverse proxy functionality.

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (earlier variant) (SHA1)
objects.description: Earlier variant of libsophos.so used by Pygmy Goat; VMProtect obfuscation and missing reverse proxy functionality.

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (earlier variant) (SHA256)
objects.description: Earlier variant of libsophos.so used by Pygmy Goat; VMProtect obfuscation and missing reverse proxy functionality.

objects.name: pygmy goat
objects.description: Pygmy Goat is a native x86-32 ELF shared object backdoor (libsophos.so) observed on Sophos XG firewall devices. It achieves persistence by being injected into /bin/sshd via LD_PRELOAD, immediately unsetting the variable after loading, and hooks the accept function to monitor inbound SSH connections for magic bytes (e.g., SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_5.3p1) as a covert trigger. It also listens on a raw ICMP socket for AES-256-CBC encrypted port-knock packets that carry a callback IP and port. On activation, it establishes a TLS C2 connection validated against an embedded Root CA certificate that impersonates FortiGate/Fortinet. Available commands include remote shells (/bin/sh and /bin/csh), interactive crontab tasking via a statically embedded BusyBox 1.33.1 crond, libpcap-based packet capture, and a reverse SOCKS5 proxy using EarthWorm code. C2 messaging is LZO1X-compressed. Earlier variants lacked the reverse proxy and were protected with VMProtect. The malware uses Unix sockets for internal IPC, supports multiple wake-up mechanisms, and appears designed for general Linux environments, though artifacts (e.g., FortiGate CA claims and .fgmon_cli.ipc) suggest FortiGate targeting as well.

objects.name: castletap
objects.description: Referenced by Mandiant as part of attacks on FortiGate devices; it exhibits TTPs similar to Pygmy Goat, including use of an encrypted ICMP packet containing C2 details to establish a reverse SSL connection.

objects.name: Sophos
objects.description: Security vendor whose XG firewall devices were observed hosting the Pygmy Goat backdoor.

objects.name: Fortinet Ltd.
objects.description: Network device vendor; the embedded Root CA certificate used by Pygmy Goat claims issuance by 'FortiGate, Fortinet Ltd.'.

objects.name: Mandiant
objects.description: Security vendor cited for reporting on attacks against FortiGate devices and the CASTLETAP malware with similar TTPs.

objects.name: CrowdStrike
objects.description: Security vendor cited for prior reporting on threat actor use of EarthWorm.

objects.name: Dynamic Linker Hijacking
objects.description: Pygmy Goat uses the LD_PRELOAD environment variable to inject into sshd

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create a /bin/sh or /bin/csh remote shell

objects.name: Scheduled Task/Job: Cron
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create arbitrary cron tasks using crontab

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication
objects.description: Pygmy Goat uses Unix sockets for inter-process communication between parent and forked child processes

objects.name: Network Sniffing
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can use libpcap to sniff network traffic according to a BPF filter and exfiltrate it to the C2

objects.name: Traffic Signaling: Port Knocking
objects.description: Pygmy Goat listens on an ICMP raw socket for encrypted packets containing magic bytes and the C2 address to connect back to

objects.name: Data Obfuscation: Protocol Impersonation
objects.description: Pygmy Goat responds to an SSH connection that sends magic bytes with a fake SSH handshake

objects.name: Encrypted Channel: Asymmetric Cryptography
objects.description: Pygmy Goat encrypts C2 communications with TLS

objects.name: Protocol Tunneling
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create a reverse SOCKS5 proxy server to tunnel traffic through it

objects.name: Archive Collected Data: Archive via Library
objects.description: Pygmy Goat compresses its C2 communications with LZO1X

objects.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
objects.description: Pygmy Goat exfiltrates its result data over its C2 channel

objects.name: pygmy_goat_aes_key
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: pygmy_goat_magic_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule pygmy_goat_magic_strings
{

meta:

        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Pygmy Goat magic byte sequences used in C2 comms"
        date = "2024-10-22"
        hash1 = "71f70d61af00542b2e9ad64abd2dda7e437536ff"

strings:

$c2_magic_handshake = ",bEB3?=o"
$fake_ssh_banner = "SSH-2.0-D8pjE"
$fake_ed25519_key = { 29 cc f0 cc 16 c5 46 6e 52 19 82 8e 86

65 42 8c 1f 1a d4 c3 a5 b1 cb fc c0 26 6c 31 3c 5c 90 3a 24 7d e4 d3 57
6d da 8e cb f4 66 d1 cb 81 4f 63 fd 4a fa 06 e4 7e 4c a0 95 91 bd cb 97
a4 b3 0f }

condition:

(uint32(0) == 0x464c457f) and any of them

}

objects.name: earthworm_id_generation_x86
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule earthworm_id_generation_x86
{

meta:

        author = "NCSC"
        description = "EarthWorm pool num generation x86 assembly"
        date = "2024-10-22"
        hash1 = "71f70d61af00542b2e9ad64abd2dda7e437536ff"

strings:

$chartoi = {

8b 45 ??        // MOV
c1 e0 07        // SHL
89 c1           // MOV
8b 55 ??        // MOV
8b 45 ??        // MOV
01 d0           // ADD
0f b6 00        // MOVZX
0f be c0        // MOVSX
01 c8           // ADD
89 45 ??        // MOV
83 6d ?? 01     // SUB

EAX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,0x7
ECX,EAX
EDX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,EDX
EAX,byte ptr [EAX]
EAX,AL
EAX,ECX
dword ptr [EBP + ??],EAX
dword ptr [EBP + ??],0x1

}

condition:

}

(uint32(0) == 0x464c457f) and all of them

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Pygmy Goat
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. pygmy goat.
